title: Paradise Springs 2015 Meritage (Virginia)
description: This Petit Verdot-heavy blend is deep in color and complexity. A heady bouquet of black plum, clove, cedar, black-currant leaf and licorice carries to the palate. Well balanced by ample acidity and plentiful, yet smooth tannins, this is silky in feel. The finish is long, with tones of oak spice and black tea.

title: Parri 2012 Tenuta Cortecciano Urbana  (Chianti Montespertoli)
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and dark fruit lead the nose of this wine. The dense palate offers black plum, clove and white pepper notes alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Père Anselme 2017 La Fiole Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Whiffs of cherry blossom, sour cherry and raspberry introduce this pale-pink rosé. Moderately concentrated on the palate, it offers delicate wild strawberry and red currant tones intensified by a clean, mineral backbone. A full-bodied yet refreshing wine to enjoy now.

title: Quartz Reef 2016 Bendigo Estate Single Ferment Ginger Pinot Noir (Central Otago)
description: There are plenty of bright red fruits and secondary earthy complexities, but at the moment the oak overpowers, cloaking the wine in rather soapy toasty and cedar notes. The palate is elegant and restrained, certainly set up for the long haul, this needs time in the cellar for things to settle. Drink 2020–2026.

title: R.J. Wines 2017 Beyond the Pale Boushey Vineyard Syrah Rosé (Yakima Valley)
description: A light electric pink, the aromas bring notes of watermelon bubblegum, cherry and strawberry. It drinks dry with medium-bodied slightly fat-feeling fruit flavors, with grapefruit notes on the finish.
designation: Beyond the Pale Boushey Vineyard Syrah

title: Rodney Strong 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Rounded and creamy with a touch of citrus, this floral aromatic wine is simple in its approachable layering of lemon zest and tropical pineapple. The oak is supportive and spicy in vanilla bean and nutmeg.

title: Rubus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)
description: Pale gold in color, ripe tropical and stone fruits, along with bruised apple and guava, white pepper and a smattering of snow peas can be coaxed from the glass after some swirling. The palate is medium bodied and oily in texture, but there is enough acid—along with lemon and herbal flavors—to keep things bright.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Heroe Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, part of the winery's series dedicated to its labor crew, is a fresh herbally laced take on Cab, with peppercorns, asphalt, smoke and earth decorating the tangy black-plum aromas on the nose. Red cherry and plum start the sip, followed by crushed gravel, more smoke and dried herbs.

title: Signano 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano
description: This wine's subtle white flower and orchard fruit scents float out of the glass. On the juicy, rounded palate, a bitter almond note underscores yellow pear and ripe apple flavors.

title: Summer Water 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This smartly named rosé is a beautiful shade of pink, and sports aromas of raspberry, melon and flint. The flavors are subtle and soft, with watermelon, strawberry and tangerine touches, proving easy to like and mellow.

title: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey 2015 Merlot (Colorado)
description: The smoky nose shows aromas of black pepper, tobacco and leather. Ample acidity on the palate is highlighted by juicy blue fruit flavors, alongside green tobacco leaf, black pepper and wood smoke with spicy, gritty tannins. This finishes on strong notes of leather over cranberry and smoked pepper.
winery: The Winery At Holy Cross Abbey

title: Titus 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is simple in structure and ample in density. It is full bodied and plush on the palate in black cherry, berry and a richness of vanilla wafer.

title: Villa San Juliette 2013 Reserve Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Very dark in the glass but not thick, this bottling shows roasted black plum, coffee and charred vanilla bean on the nose. The palate is layered with that vanilla flavor and cut by a slow-rising acidity, offering flavors of tangy blackberry and espresso on the finish.

title: Zantho 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)
description: It introduces itself with a hint of passion fruit, a touch of grass. While the nose just teases, the palate gives bright lemon freshness and juicy yellow plum. This is bright, light, dry, fruit-driven and refreshing.

title: Airfield Estates 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of green flower, bountiful citrus peel, fresh herb, kiwi and scooped honeydew melon. The broad feeling but lighter styled kiwi flavors bring appeal, with a pink-grapefruit snap on the finish.

title: Andeluna 2017 1300 Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: A deep purple color and beefy berry aromas give this Malbec up-front strength. In the mouth, this is alert due to prodding acidity. Cherry, plum and berry flavors are textbook, while this is saucy tasting on a direct finish.

title: Badia di Morrona 2014 I Sodi del Paretaio Riserva  (Chianti)
description: Earthy aromas of truffle, new leather and underbrush mingle with whiffs of dark-skinned fruit in this wine. The rounded, full-bodied palate offers dried cherry and star anise notes framed in polished tannins.

title: Barrel Burner 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This is likely to become a very popular wine, thanks to an inviting nose of lemon candy, white peach, pineapple, plumeria and a hint of guava, all leveled by a chalky minerality. The palate is zippy and tense, yet also somewhat crowd-pleasingly sweet with ripe apple and pear flavors.

title: Barton & Guestier 2017 Petite Nancy  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Juicy, fruity and with a good balance between acidity and crisp apple flavors, this wine is ripe and full of fruitiness. It has a zesty tang as well as some minerality that balances the great fruit. Drink now.

title: Bieler Père et Fils 2017 Sabine Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This blend of Grenache and Syrah is soft and bright, with plenty of red-berry and currant flavors. Its fruitiness and balanced acidity make for an immediately attractive, easy wine. Drink now.

title: Boeger 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This wine is dark and rich but also very approachable for this notoriously tannic varietal. The tannins are moderate and the blackberry and blueberry flavors so concentrated that they balance out the tannins and make the mouth feel velvety.

title: Buccia Nera 2016 Guarniente  (Chianti)
description: Made entirely from organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with dark-skinned berry and baking spice aromas, with an earthy hint of underbrush. The straightforward, juicy palate offers red plum, clove and cinnamon touches alongside polished tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Yellow apple, peach and banana make for a fruity entrance to this unoaked Chardonnay. There's nice weight and roundness to the palate, with ample acidity to back it up.

title: Cass 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry, cracked pepper, crushed herbs, licorice and coffee show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Merlot, 8% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. There is decent heft to the sip, which offers flavors of blackberry, oregano, anise and a pinch of dill.

title: Castellani 2015 Famiglia Castellani Riserva  (Chianti)
description: This leads with red fruit, tilled earth and leather aromas. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, white pepper and star anise flavors alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.

title: Castelvecchio di Filippo Rocchi 2016  Chianti
description: Red plum and green peppercorn aromas lead the nose of this wine while the straightforward palate offers clove, blackberry and tobacco flavors. Polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2021.

title: Cecchi 2016  Chianti
description: Fragrant blue flower, wild berry and underbrush aromas take center stage in this enjoyable red. The bright, supple palate doles out juicy black cherry, clove and tobacco leaf notes, offset by easygoing tannins. Drink soon.

title: Château de la Noblesse 2016 Rosé (Bandol)
description: Owned by the same family for five generations, this estate has 34 acres of vines. This spicy, peppery wine comes from the dominant Mourvèdre with Grenache and Cinsault. The wine is less about bright fruit and more about concentration, with a generous texture that will benefit from softening. Drink from 2018.

title: Château de Nages 2017 Buti Nages White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Soft, lemony acidity lends a sunny feel to crisp yellow apple and pear flavors here. Full bodied yet fresh, it's a thirst-quenching dry wine accented by white blossom and almond hints. Enjoy now–2020.

title: Château Gabaron 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Fruity, crisp and with a tight texture, this is a concentrated wine. Piles of acidity, crisp grapefruit and lemon, and a strongly zesty character join in this delicious wine that is ready to drink.
